meanings.sent1: She decided to preenact the play before the actual performance to ensure everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The company will preenact the new policy next month to avoid any last-minute issues.
meanings.sent3: The students preenacted a surprise party for their teacher, who was genuinely shocked.
meanings.sent4: His detailed planning allowed him to preenact the project like a well-rehearsed play.
meanings.sent5: The team's ability to preenact the emergency drill saved lives during the actual crisis.

meanings.definition: To make preparations for enacting something in the future
meanings.sent1: Before the trip, they preenacted their packing list to ensure they didn't forget anything.
meanings.sent2: The chef will preenact the menu for the event to make sure all ingredients are available.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels preenacted their winter food stash by collecting extra acorns just in case.
meanings.sent4: She liked to preenact her morning routine the night before to save time.
meanings.sent5: The team preenacted the rescue mission, going over every detail to ensure success.
